heisig_chinese_memo: The Japanese pear tree is the most profit able in the world, because it produces its fruit in pairs [sorry for the awful pun].
heisig_constituent: pear tree, profit, wheat, cereal, sword, sabre, saber, tree, wood
koohiiStory1: The Japanese pear tree is the most profitable in the world, because it produces its fruit in pairs [sorry for the awful pun].
koohiiStory2: And a profit in a pear tree...12 days of christmas.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The grain you cut off a tree with a knife is a pear. I don't know if you've ever seen Asian pears, but they're pretty big and sturdy. You can't just pick them off of the tree, you need the help of a knife. That's why this is a pear, and not an apple or peach or something else.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine standing below a tree full of pears. You take your knife and carefully cut them all down, one by one.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As you cut the pears down, you can't help but gnash (なし) your teeth. You want to eat these pears right now. You gnash and grind and wait though, because you want to have them all down before you start the feast.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine a beautiful, ripe pear in your mind. Now gnash your teeth. Mmm. You want to eat a pear right now, don't you?

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The Japanese pear tree is the most profit able in the world, because it produces its fruit in pairs [sorry for the awful pun].
humanum_full_description_en:
Xiaozhuan from " wood ", " 𥝢 " sound. " 𥝢 " is the same as "利", and "棃" and "梨" are different. " Pear " is the name of the fruit tree, which means both the pear tree and the fruit of the pear tree. "Said Wen": "Pear, fruit name. Congmu, 𥝢 sound. 𥝢, ancient Wenli." Such as "Zhuangzi. "Human World": "Huainanzi, Citrus Citrus Pomelo, a genus of fruit juice, peel off when it is ripe, and shame when peeled off." "Huainanzi. Shuo Lin: "Pears, oranges, jujubes and chestnuts have different flavors, but they are all blended in the mouth.

" Pear " is also a cursive name. "Shan Hai Jing. "Zhongshan Jing": "Ten miles to the southeast, it is called Taishan. There is Caoyan, the name is pear, and its leaves are like hagi and red flowers, which can be gangrene."

" Pears " mean "剺", which means split. Such as "Han Shu. "The Second Story of Yang Xiong": "Divided pears into a single place, and they belong to the country." Yan Shi's ancient note: "Pears and Yan are the same, which is called peeling analysis." "Later Han Shu. "The Biography of Geng Bing": "The Xiongnu cried when hearing about the death, or bleeds to the face." Li Xian's note: "The word "D" is the word used in ancient times."

" Pear " also means " Li " to express the public. For example, in the Han Dynasty "Tongbai Huaiyuan Temple Stele": "Dangshu Laizhi, the people used as a tribute." "Dangshu" refers to the common people. Another example is the Southern Dynasties Liang Xu Mian's "Shixing Zhongwu King Stele": "Public honors are used to transform the gangsters, and the sleeves are used to approve the barbarians." "Peng gang" means "Li people", and "褰襜" refers to raising the curtain of the car.
humanum_short_description_en: Xiao Zhuan starts with " wood ", " 𥝢 " sound. " 𥝢 " is the same as "利", and "棃" and "梨" are different. " Pear " is the name of the fruit tree, which means both the pear tree and the fruit of the pear tree.
humanum_full_description:
小篆從「木」，「𥝢」聲。「𥝢」同「利」，「棃」和「梨」是異體。「梨」是果木名，既表示梨樹，也表示梨樹的果實。《說文》：「梨，果名。从木，𥝢聲。𥝢，古文利。」如《莊子．人間世》：「夫柤梨橘柚，果蓏之屬，實熟則剝，剝則辱。」《淮南子．說林》：「梨橘棗栗不同味，而皆調於口。」

　　「梨」也是草名。《山海經．中山經》：「又東南十里，曰太山。有草焉，名曰梨，其葉狀如萩而赤華，可以已疽。」

　　「梨」通「剺」，表示割裂。如《漢書．揚雄傳下》：「分梨單于，磔裂屬國。」顏師古注：「梨與剺同，謂剝析也。」《後漢書．耿弇列傳》：「匈奴聞秉卒，舉國號哭，或至棃面流血。」李賢注：「棃即剺字，古通用也。」

　　「梨」也通「黎」，表示眾。如漢代〈桐柏淮源廟碑〉：「棃庶賴祉，民用作頌。」「棃庶」即百姓。又如南朝梁徐勉〈始興忠武王碑〉：「公褰襜以化棃氓，張袖以納夷狄。」「棃氓」即「黎民」，「褰襜」指撩起車帷。
humanum_short_description: 小篆從「木」，「𥝢」聲。「𥝢」同「利」，「棃」和「梨」是異體。「梨」是果木名，既表示梨樹，也表示梨樹的果實。

小篆從「 木 」，「 𥝢 」聲。「 𥝢 」同「 利 」，「 棃 」和「 梨 」是異體。「 梨 」是果木名，既表示梨樹，也表示梨樹的果實。《說文》：「梨，果名。从木，𥝢聲。𥝢，古文利。」如《莊子．人間世》：「夫柤梨橘柚，果蓏之屬，實熟則剝，剝則辱。」《淮南子．說林》：「梨橘棗栗不同味，而皆調於口。」 「 梨 」也是草名。《山海經．中山經》：「又東南十里，曰太山。有草焉，名曰梨，其葉狀如萩而赤華，可以已疽。」 「 梨 」通「 剺 」，表示割裂。如《漢書．揚雄傳下》：「分梨單于，磔裂屬國。」顏師古注：「梨與剺同，謂剝析也。」《後漢書．耿弇列傳》：「匈奴聞秉卒，舉國號哭，或至棃面流血。」李賢注：「棃即剺字，古通用也。」 「 梨 」也通「 黎 」，表示眾。如漢代〈桐柏淮源廟碑〉：「棃庶賴祉，民用作頌。」「棃庶」即百姓。又如南朝梁徐勉〈始興忠武王碑〉：「公褰襜以化棃氓，張袖以納夷狄。」「棃氓」即「黎民」，「褰襜」指撩起車帷。
Xiaozhuan from " wood", " 𥝢" sound. " 𥝢" is the same as " 利", and " 棃" and " 梨" are different. " Pear" is the name of the fruit tree, which means both the pear tree and the fruit of the pear tree. "Said Wen": "Pear, fruit name. Congmu, 𥝢 sound. 𥝢, ancient Wenli." Such as "Zhuangzi. "Human World": "Huainanzi, Citrus Citrus Pomelo, a genus of fruit juice, peel off when it is ripe, and shame when peeled off." "Huainanzi. Shuo Lin: "Pears, oranges, jujubes and chestnuts have different flavors, but they are all blended in the mouth. " Pear" is also a cursive name. "Shan Hai Jing. "Zhongshan Jing": "Ten miles to the southeast, it is called Taishan. There is Caoyan, the name is pear, and its leaves are like hagi and red flowers, which can be gangrene." " Pears" mean " 剺", which means split. Such as "Han Shu. "The Second Story of Yang Xiong": "Divided pears into a single place, and they belong to the country." Yan Shi's ancient note: "Pears and Yan are the same, which is called peeling analysis." "Later Han Shu. "The Biography of Geng Bing": "The Xiongnu cried when hearing about the death, or bleeds to the face." Li Xian's note: "The word "D" is the word used in ancient times." " Pear" also means " Li" to express the public. For example, in the Han Dynasty "Tongbai Huaiyuan Temple Stele": "Dangshu Laizhi, the people used as a tribute." "Dangshu" refers to the common people. Another example is the Southern Dynasties Liang Xu Mian's "Shixing Zhongwu King Stele": "Public honors are used to transform the gangsters, and the sleeves are used to approve the barbarians." "Peng gang" means "Li people", and "褰襜" refers to raising the curtain of the car.

梨字的基本解释

梨
lí
落叶乔木或灌木，果实是普通水果，品种很多：梨膏。广梨。鸭梨。

梨字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lí］
［《廣韻》力脂切，平脂，來。］
亦作“梸1”。亦作“棃1”。
(1)果木名。落叶乔木，叶子卵形。花多为白色。果实多汁，可食。
(2)梨树的果实。
(3)草名。
(4)年老。
(5)通“剺”。割裂，剖离。
(6)通“黎”。参见“梨庶”、“梨氓”。

梨字的英文翻译

◎ 梨
pear

梨字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　梨； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页530第12
同棃。

梨字的源字形

梨字的起名意思

：木名，落叶乔木或灌木，果实是普通水果，后用来形容女子的美貌。

Basic explanation of words
pear
lí
Deciduous trees or shrubs, the fruit is common fruit, there are many varieties: pear paste. Guangli. Ya pear.
pear
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [lí]
["Guangyun" Lizhi cut, flat fat, come. ]
Also known as "梸1". Also known as "棃1".
(1) The name of the fruit tree. Deciduous trees, ovoid leaves. The flowers are mostly white. The fruit is juicy and edible.
(2) The fruit of the pear tree.
(3) Cursive name.
(4) Old age.
(5) Through "剺". Split, split.
(6) Link "Li". See "Li Shu", "Li Meng".
pear

pear

pear
Name meaning
: Wooden name, deciduous tree or shrub, the fruit is an ordinary fruit, later used to describe the beauty of a woman.
形声字。木表意,篆书之形像棵树,表示梨是果木;秒(利h)表声,利是魏的省文,熬是黄黑色,表示梨子的皮多为黄褐
色。梨是一种果树。
①梨树,落叶乔木或灌木,果实是普通水果,品种很多。2
这种植物的果实,有的地区也叫梨子。
~膏 ~树 ~园 ~子 白~ 地~ 杜~凤~

时 的f 位 山yi 的
Пиктофонетические символы.
Значение дерева в том, что шрифт печати подобен дереву, что означает, что груши - это фруктовые деревья; второе (лих) означает, что звук является провинциальным языком Вэй, а нарыв желто-черный, что означает, что Кожица груш в основном желто-коричневая.
Груша - это разновидность фруктового дерева.
①Грушевые деревья, лиственные деревья или кустарники, плоды - обычные плоды, и есть много разновидностей.
2 Плоды этого растения в некоторых регионах также называют грушей.
~ Мазь ~ Дерево ~ Юань ~ Цзыбай ~ Ди ~ Ду ~ Фэн ~
Гуан ~ Цветок ~ Осень ~ Песок ~ Тан ~ Аромат ~ Снег ~ Утка ~

Radicals: 禾, 刂, 木  (grain, knife, tree)
Meaning Mnemonic
The grain you cut off a tree with a knife is a pear. I don't know if you've ever seen Asian pears, but they're pretty big and sturdy. You can't just pick them off of the tree, you need the help of a knife. That's why this is a pear, and not an apple or peach or something else.
Imagine standing below a tree full of pears. You take your knife and carefully cut them all down, one by one.
Reading Mnemonic
As you cut the pears down, you can't help but gnash (なし) your teeth. You want to eat these pears right now. You gnash and grind and wait though, because you want to have them all down before you start the feast.
Imagine a beautiful, ripe pear in your mind. Now gnash your teeth. Mmm. You want to eat a pear right now, don't you?

Груша грушелистная — вид груш, культивируемый в Азии.
